div.l: The lyth oon vpon my wombe / and vpon̄ myn heed
Helpe Symkyn̄ for the false clerkes fighte
This Iohn sterte vp / as faste as euere he myghte
And grasped by the walles to and fro
To fynde a staf / and she sterte vp also
And knewe the estres bet than dide Iohn
And by the wal / a staf she founde anoon̄
And saugh a lytel shymeryng of a lyght
For at an hole / in shoon the mone bryght
And by that lyght / she saugh hem bothe two
But sikerly / she nyste who was who
But as she saugh / a white thyng in hir eye
And whan she gan this white thyng aspye
She wende the clerk / hadde wered a volupere
And with the staf / she drough eủere nere and nere
And wende han hitte / this Aleyn̄ atte fulle
And smote the Meller / on the piled sculle
That doıı̄un he goth / and cried harrow I dye
Thise clerkes beten hym wel / and lete hym lye
And greythen hem / and token her hors anoon
And eke here mele / and on her way they goon̄
And atte Melle ȝit they toke her cake
Of half a busshell whete / ful wel ybake
Thus is the proude Meller wel ybete
And hath ylost / the gryndyng of the whete
And paied for the soper eủerydell
Of Aleyn̄ and of Iohn / that beeten hym well
His wyf is swyued / and his doughter als
Lo swich is it a Meller to be fals
And therfore the ꝓprouerbe is seid ful soth
Hym thar not wel wene / that evel doth
A gylour shal hym self begiled be
And god that sitteth highe in mageste
Save al this company grete and smale
This have I quytte the Millere his tale
¶ Explicit fabula ⁊et c̉etera
